part.name: P2
part.heading: Duties of Responsible Persons and Registered Persons

section.name: s2
section.heading: Duties of responsible persons to keep log-books

subsection.content: The responsible person for a lift must keep in accordance with subsections (2) and (3) a log-book for the lift.

subsection.leadIn: The log-book referred to in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must contain the following information and particulars—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a description of the lift;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name and contact details of every registered lift contractor who has undertaken from the responsible person for the lift maintenance works of the lift;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: in relation to every incident relating to the lift and every other event of failure of the lift—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the particulars of the incident or the event;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: (for an incident) the name and contact details of the registered lift contractor notified under section 40 of the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: (for any other event of failure of the lift) the name and contact details of the registered lift contractor who has attended to the failure;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the information and particulars required to be entered into the log-book by a registered lift contractor under section 5;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the information and particulars required to be entered into the log-book by a registered lift engineer under section 11; and

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: any other information and particulars specified by the Director and relating to the lift.

subsection.content: Any information or particulars mentioned in subsection (2)(b)(ii), (iii), (iv) or (v) may be removed from the log-book on or after the 3rd anniversary of the date on which the information or particulars were entered into the log-book.

If an enforcement officer requests the responsible person for a lift to produce for the officer’s inspection the log-book required to be kept by the person under subsection (1), the person must comply with the request within 3 days after the date of receipt of the request.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Duties of registered lift contractors to notify Director of undertaking of lift works

subsection.content: A registered lift contractor who undertakes any maintenance works of a lift must, not later than 7 days before the first commencement day, notify in the specified form the Director of the undertaking as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.

subsection.leadIn: A registered lift contractor who undertakes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any lift works concerning any major alteration of a lift; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any lift works to which subsection (1) does not apply,

subsection.continued: must, not later than 7 days before the date of commencement of the works, notify in the specified form the Director of the undertaking as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.

subsection.content: Despite subsections (1) and (2), a registered lift contractor who undertakes any lift works under any exceptional circumstances specified by the Director must, before the date of commencement of the works, notify in the specified form the Director of the undertaking as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.def: first commencement day (工程展開首日), in relation to maintenance works of a lift that are undertaken by the registered lift contractor, means the first day on which any such works are carried out in respect of the lift for the first time in the period during which the undertaking is in force.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Duties of registered lift contractors to notify Director of subcontracting of lift works

subsection.content: A registered lift contractor who subcontracts to any other person any maintenance works of a lift must, not later than 7 days before the first commencement day, notify in the specified form the Director of the subcontracting of the works as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.

subsection.leadIn: A registered lift contractor who subcontracts to any other person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any lift works concerning any major alteration of a lift; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any lift works to which subsection (1) does not apply,

subsection.continued: must, not later than 7 days before the date of commencement of the works, notify in the specified form the Director of the subcontracting of the works as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.

subsection.content: Despite subsections (1) and (2), a registered lift contractor who subcontracts to any other person any lift works under any exceptional circumstances specified by the Director must, before the date of commencement of the works, notify in the specified form the Director of the subcontracting of the works as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.def: first commencement day (工程展開首日), in relation to maintenance works of a lift that are subcontracted to any person by the registered lift contractor, means the first day on which any such works are carried out in respect of the lift for the first time in the period during which the subcontract is in force.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Duties of registered lift contractors to enter into log-books certain information and particulars

subsection.content: A registered lift contractor who carries out any lift works for a lift, or attends to an incident relating to a lift under section 40 of the Ordinance or any other event of failure of a lift, must enter into the log-book required to be kept under section 2 for the lift the information and particulars referred to in subsection (2).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the lift works—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: (for each day on which the works are carried out for the lift) the name of every qualified person and every specified person participating in the works;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a description of the works;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the works begin; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the date on which the works are completed;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which and the time at which the incident occurs;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the nature and particulars of the incident, including (if any) the death of, or injury to, any person and damage to any property as a result of the incident;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the date on which and the time at which the investigation under section 40 of the Ordinance begins;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the date on which and the time at which the investigation under section 40 of the Ordinance is completed; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: (if applicable) the date on which and the time at which the lift resumes its normal use and operation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the event of failure—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which and the time at which the failure occurs;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the nature and particulars of the failure, including (if applicable) the number of persons trapped in the lift as a result of the failure; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: (if applicable) the date on which and the time at which the lift resumes its normal use and operation; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other information and particulars specified by the Director and relating to the lift works, incident or event of failure.

subsection.leadIn: The information and particulars required under subsection (1) to be entered into the log-book for the lift must be entered—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(a)(i), on each day on which the qualified person or the specified person participates in the lift works;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(a)(ii) and (iii), on the date on which the lift works begin;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(a)(iv), on the date on which the lift works are completed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(b)(i) and (ii), within 2 days beginning on the date on which the registered lift contractor becomes aware of the incident;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(b)(iii), on the date on which the investigation begins;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(b)(iv), on the date on which the investigation is completed;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(b)(v) and (c)(iii), on the date on which the lift resumes its normal use and operation;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(c)(i) and (ii), within 2 days beginning on the date on which the registered lift contractor becomes aware of the failure; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(d), within 2 days beginning on the date on which the registered lift contractor is notified by the Director of the information or particulars specified under that subsection.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Duties of registered lift contractors to keep certain records etc.

subsection.leadIn: A registered lift contractor who undertakes any lift works concerning the installation of a lift must keep, for a specified period, every document or manual that contains any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: design specifications of the lift;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: instructions on the installation of the lift;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: instructions or recommendations on the commissioning, examination, maintenance, operation or demolition of the lift.

subsection.content: A registered lift contractor who undertakes any maintenance works of a lift must keep, for a specified period, a record containing the details of the works specified by the Director.

If an enforcement officer requests a registered lift contractor to produce for the officer’s inspection the document, manual or record required to be kept by the contractor under subsection (1) or (2), the contractor must comply with the request within 3 days after the date of receipt of the request.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to subsection (1), the period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: beginning on the date of completion of the installation of the lift; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ending at midnight on the date immediately before the 7th anniversary of the completion date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to subsection (2), the period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: beginning on the date of completion of the works; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ending at midnight on the date immediately before the 3rd anniversary of the completion date.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Duties of registered lift contractors regarding incidents relating to lifts

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the responsible contractor for a lift becomes aware that there is an incident relating to the lift;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the normal use and operation of the lift is suspended, because of the incident, at any time before the end of the 4-hour period after the contractor becomes aware of the incident; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in all the circumstances of the case, it is unlikely that the normal use and operation of the lift can be resumed before the end of that period,

subsection.continued: the responsible contractor must, within the 4-hour period mentioned in paragraph (b), display in a conspicuous part of the lift, or in a conspicuous place in the vicinity of the lift, a notice that complies with the requirements in subsection (2).

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1) must be in the specified form and must contain the information and particulars, including the reason for the suspension, specified in the form.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

def.name: ResponsibleContractor
def.leadIn: responsible contractor (負責承辦商), in relation to a lift, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registered lift contractor who currently undertakes any lift works in respect of the lift; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if paragraph (a) does not apply, the registered lift contractor who most recently has undertaken any lift works in respect of the lift.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Duties of registered lift contractors regarding failure of certain emergency devices

subsection.content: If a registered lift contractor who undertakes any of the maintenance works of a lift becomes aware that there is a failure of any emergency device of the lift, the contractor must, within 4 hours after the contractor becomes aware of the failure, attend to the failure.

If, in all the circumstances of the case, it is unlikely that the failure of the emergency device can be rectified within 24 hours after the registered lift contractor becomes aware of the failure, the contractor must, before the end of the 24-hour period, notify in the specified form the Director of the failure as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

def.name: EmergencyDevice
def.leadIn: emergency device (緊急裝置), in relation to a lift, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the alarm system of the lift;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the emergency lighting of the lift;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the intercommunication system of the lift; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the ventilation fan of the car of the lift.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Duties of registered lift contractors to notify Director if registered lift contractors unable or unwilling to continue to undertake lift works

subsection.content: If for any reason a registered lift contractor who has undertaken any lift works is subsequently unable or unwilling to continue to undertake the works, the contractor must, within 14 days after the date on which the contractor ceases to undertake the works, notify in the specified form the Director of the fact and the date of cessation of the undertaking.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Duties of registered lift contractors to notify Registrar of certain changes

subsection.content: If there is a change in the name, business address or other correspondence address of a registered lift contractor, the contractor must, within 14 days after the date on which the change takes place, notify in the specified form the Registrar of the change.

If a registered lift engineer or registered lift worker employed by a registered lift contractor under a contract of employment dies, ceases to be such an engineer or worker, or otherwise ceases to be employed by the contractor, the contractor must, within 14 days after the date on which the death or cessation takes place, notify in the specified form the Registrar of the death or cessation.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Duties of registered lift engineers to enter into log-books information and particulars regarding examination of lifts

subsection.content: A registered lift engineer who undertakes to examine a lift, or any associated equipment or machinery of the lift, must enter into the log-book required to be kept under section 2 for the lift the information and particulars referred to in subsection (2).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of every qualified person and every specified person participating in the examination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which and the time at which the examination begins;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which and the time at which the examination is completed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the result of the examination; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other information and particulars specified by the Director and relating to the examination.

subsection.content: The information and particulars required under subsection (1) to be entered into the log-book for the lift must be entered on the date on which the examination is completed.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Duties of registered lift engineers to keep certain documents

subsection.leadIn: A registered lift engineer must keep in accordance with subsection (2) a copy of the following documents prepared by the engineer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every certificate issued by the engineer under section 24(4) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every report referred to in section 24(7) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: every certificate issued by the engineer under section 25(2) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: every report referred to in section 25(5) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: The registered lift engineer must keep the copy of the document for a specified period.

If an enforcement officer requests a registered lift engineer to produce for the officer’s inspection any copy required to be kept by the engineer under this section, the engineer must comply with the request within 3 days after the date of receipt of the request.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

def.name: SpecifiedPeriod
def.leadIn: specified period (指明期間) means the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning on the date of completion of the examination; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ending at midnight on the date immediately before the 3rd anniversary of the completion date.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Duties of registered lift engineers to notify Registrar of certain changes

subsection.content: If there is a change in the name or correspondence address of a registered lift engineer, the engineer must, within 14 days after the date on which the change takes place, notify in the specified form the Registrar of the change.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Registered lift engineers to carry with them registration cards etc.

subsection.leadIn: A registered lift engineer who personally carries out any lift works, or supervises any other person to carry out any lift works, must, at all times while the engineer is at the place at which the works are carried out, carry with them—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant registration card or the relevant certificate of registration that is in force; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other documentary proof recognized by the Director.

subsection.content: If an enforcement officer at the place mentioned in subsection (1) requests the registered lift engineer to produce the card, certificate or documentary proof referred to in that subsection for the officer’s inspection, the engineer must comply with the request.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

subsection.def: relevant certificate of registration (有關註冊證書), in relation to a registered lift engineer, means the certificate of registration issued to the engineer in respect of the registration;
relevant registration card (有關註冊證), in relation to a registered lift engineer, means the registration card issued to the engineer in respect of the registration.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Duties of registered lift workers to notify Registrar of certain changes

subsection.content: If there is a change in the name or correspondence address of a registered lift worker, the worker must, within 14 days after the date on which the change takes place, notify in the specified form the Registrar of the change.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Registered lift workers to carry with them registration cards etc.

subsection.leadIn: A registered lift worker who personally carries out any lift works, or supervises any other person to carry out any lift works, must, at all times while the worker is at the place at which the works are carried out, carry with them—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant registration card or the relevant certificate of registration that is in force; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other documentary proof recognized by the Director.

subsection.content: If an enforcement officer at the place mentioned in subsection (1) requests the registered lift worker to produce the card, certificate or documentary proof referred to in that subsection for the officer’s inspection, the worker must comply with the request.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

subsection.def: relevant certificate of registration (有關註冊證書), in relation to a registered lift worker, means the certificate of registration issued to the worker in respect of the registration;
relevant registration card (有關註冊證), in relation to a registered lift worker, means the registration card issued to the worker in respect of the registration.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Duties of responsible persons to keep log-books

subsection.content: The responsible person for an escalator must keep in accordance with subsections (2) and (3) a log-book for the escalator.

subsection.leadIn: The log-book referred to in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must contain the following information and particulars—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a description of the escalator;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name and contact details of every registered escalator contractor who has undertaken from the responsible person for the escalator maintenance works of the escalator;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: in relation to every incident relating to the escalator and every other event of failure of the escalator—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the particulars of the incident or the event;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: (for an incident) the name and contact details of the registered escalator contractor notified under section 70 of the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: (for any other event of failure of the escalator) the name and contact details of the registered escalator contractor who has attended to the failure;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the information and particulars required to be entered into the log-book by a registered escalator contractor under section 20;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the information and particulars required to be entered into the log-book by a registered escalator engineer under section 25; and

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: any other information and particulars specified by the Director and relating to the escalator.

subsection.content: Any information or particulars mentioned in subsection (2)(b)(ii), (iii), (iv) or (v) may be removed from the log-book on or after the 3rd anniversary of the date on which the information or particulars were entered into the log-book.

If an enforcement officer requests the responsible person for an escalator to produce for the officer’s inspection the log-book required to be kept by the person under subsection (1), the person must comply with the request within 3 days after the date of receipt of the request.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator contractors to notify Director of undertaking of escalator works

subsection.content: A registered escalator contractor who undertakes any maintenance works of an escalator must, not later than 7 days before the first commencement day, notify in the specified form the Director of the undertaking as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.

subsection.leadIn: A registered escalator contractor who undertakes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any escalator works concerning any major alteration of an escalator; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any escalator works to which subsection (1) does not apply,

subsection.continued: must, not later than 7 days before the date of commencement of the works, notify in the specified form the Director of the undertaking as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.

subsection.content: Despite subsections (1) and (2), a registered escalator contractor who undertakes any escalator works under any exceptional circumstances specified by the Director must, before the date of commencement of the works, notify in the specified form the Director of the undertaking as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.def: first commencement day (工程展開首日), in relation to maintenance works of an escalator that are undertaken by the registered escalator contractor, means the first day on which any such works are carried out in respect of the escalator for the first time in the period during which the undertaking is in force.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator contractors to notify Director of subcontracting of escalator works

subsection.content: A registered escalator contractor who subcontracts to any other person any maintenance works of an escalator must, not later than 7 days before the first commencement day, notify in the specified form the Director of the subcontracting of the works as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.

subsection.leadIn: A registered escalator contractor who subcontracts to any other person—

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any escalator works to which subsection (1) does not apply,

subsection.continued: must, not later than 7 days before the date of commencement of the works, notify in the specified form the Director of the subcontracting of the works as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.

subsection.content: Despite subsections (1) and (2), a registered escalator contractor who subcontracts to any other person any escalator works under any exceptional circumstances specified by the Director must, before the date of commencement of the works, notify in the specified form the Director of the subcontracting of the works as well as other information and particulars specified in the form.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.def: first commencement day (工程展開首日), in relation to maintenance works of an escalator that are subcontracted to any person by the registered escalator contractor, means the first day on which any such works are carried out in respect of the escalator for the first time in the period during which the subcontract is in force.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator contractors to enter into log-books certain information and particulars

subsection.content: A registered escalator contractor who carries out any escalator works for an escalator, or attends to an incident relating to an escalator under section 70 of the Ordinance or any other event of failure of an escalator, must enter into the log-book required to be kept under section 17 for the escalator the information and particulars referred to in subsection (2).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the escalator works—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: (for each day on which the works are carried out for the escalator) the name of every qualified person and every specified person participating in the works;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a description of the works;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the works begin; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the date on which the works are completed;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which and the time at which the incident occurs;

subparagraph.name: ii

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: (if applicable) the date on which and the time at which the escalator resumes its normal use and operation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the event of failure—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which and the time at which the failure occurs;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the nature and particulars of the failure; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: (if applicable) the date on which and the time at which the escalator resumes its normal use and operation; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other information and particulars specified by the Director and relating to the escalator works, incident or event of failure.

subsection.leadIn: The information and particulars required under subsection (1) to be entered into the log-book for the escalator must be entered—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(a)(i), on each day on which the qualified person or the specified person participates in the escalator works;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(a)(ii) and (iii), on the date on which the escalator works begin;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(a)(iv), on the date on which the escalator works are completed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(b)(i) and (ii), within 2 days beginning on the date on which the registered escalator contractor becomes aware of the incident;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(b)(iii), on the date on which the investigation begins;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(b)(iv), on the date on which the investigation is completed;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(b)(v) and (c)(iii), on the date on which the escalator resumes its normal use and operation;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(c)(i) and (ii), within 2 days beginning on the date on which the registered escalator contractor becomes aware of the failure; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2)(d), within 2 days beginning on the date on which the registered escalator contractor is notified by the Director of the information or particulars specified under that subsection.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator contractors to keep certain records etc.

subsection.leadIn: A registered escalator contractor who undertakes any escalator works concerning the installation of an escalator must keep, for a specified period, every document or manual that contains any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: instructions or recommendations on the commissioning, examination, maintenance, operation or demolition of the escalator.

subsection.content: A registered escalator contractor who undertakes any maintenance works of an escalator must keep, for a specified period, a record containing the details of the works specified by the Director.

If an enforcement officer requests a registered escalator contractor to produce for the officer’s inspection the document, manual or record required to be kept by the contractor under subsection (1) or (2), the contractor must comply with the request within 3 days after the date of receipt of the request.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to subsection (1), the period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: beginning on the date of completion of the installation of the escalator; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ending at midnight on the date immediately before the 7th anniversary of the completion date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to subsection (2), the period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: beginning on the date of completion of the works; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ending at midnight on the date immediately before the 3rd anniversary of the completion date.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator contractors regarding incidents relating to escalators

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the responsible contractor for an escalator becomes aware that there is an incident relating to the escalator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the normal use and operation of the escalator is suspended, because of the incident, at any time before the end of the 4-hour period after the contractor becomes aware of the incident; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in all the circumstances of the case, it is unlikely that the normal use and operation of the escalator can be resumed before the end of that period,

subsection.continued: the responsible contractor must, within the 4-hour period mentioned in paragraph (b), display in a conspicuous part of the escalator, or in a conspicuous place in the vicinity of the escalator, a notice that complies with the requirements in subsection (2).

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1) must be in the specified form and must contain the information and particulars, including the reason for the suspension, specified in the form.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

def.name: ResponsibleContractor
def.leadIn: responsible contractor (負責承辦商), in relation to an escalator, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registered escalator contractor who currently undertakes any escalator works in respect of the escalator; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if paragraph (a) does not apply, the registered escalator contractor who most recently has undertaken any escalator works in respect of the escalator.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator contractors to notify Director if registered escalator contractors unable or unwilling to continue to undertake escalator works

subsection.content: If for any reason a registered escalator contractor who has undertaken any escalator works is subsequently unable or unwilling to continue to undertake the works, the contractor must, within 14 days after the date on which the contractor ceases to undertake the works, notify in the specified form the Director of the fact and the date of cessation of the undertaking.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator contractors to notify Registrar of certain changes

subsection.content: If there is a change in the name, business address or other correspondence address of a registered escalator contractor, the contractor must, within 14 days after the date on which the change takes place, notify in the specified form the Registrar of the change.

If a registered escalator engineer or registered escalator worker employed by a registered escalator contractor under a contract of employment dies, ceases to be such an engineer or worker, or otherwise ceases to be employed by the contractor, the contractor must, within 14 days after the date on which the death or cessation takes place, notify in the specified form the Registrar of the death or cessation.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator engineers to enter into log-books information and particulars regarding examination of escalators

subsection.content: A registered escalator engineer who undertakes to examine an escalator, or any associated equipment or machinery of the escalator, must enter into the log-book required to be kept under section 17 for the escalator the information and particulars referred to in subsection (2).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of every qualified person and every specified person participating in the examination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which and the time at which the examination begins;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which and the time at which the examination is completed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the result of the examination; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other information and particulars specified by the Director and relating to the examination.

subsection.content: The information and particulars required under subsection (1) to be entered into the log-book for the escalator must be entered on the date on which the examination is completed.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator engineers to keep certain documents

subsection.leadIn: A registered escalator engineer must keep in accordance with subsection (2) a copy of the following documents prepared by the engineer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every certificate issued by the engineer under section 54(3) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every report referred to in section 54(6) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: every certificate issued by the engineer under section 55(2) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: every report referred to in section 55(5) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: The registered escalator engineer must keep the copy of the document for a specified period.

If an enforcement officer requests a registered escalator engineer to produce for the officer’s inspection any copy required to be kept by the engineer under this section, the engineer must comply with the request within 3 days after the date of receipt of the request.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

def.name: SpecifiedPeriod
def.leadIn: specified period (指明期間) means the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning on the date of completion of the examination; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ending at midnight on the date immediately before the 3rd anniversary of the completion date.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator engineers to notify Registrar of certain changes

section.heading: Registered escalator engineers to carry with them registration cards etc.

subsection.leadIn: A registered escalator engineer who personally carries out any escalator works, or supervises any other person to carry out any escalator works, must, at all times while the engineer is at the place at which the works are carried out, carry with them—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant registration card or the relevant certificate of registration that is in force; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other documentary proof recognized by the Director.

subsection.content: If an enforcement officer at the place mentioned in subsection (1) requests the registered escalator engineer to produce the card, certificate or documentary proof referred to in that subsection for the officer’s inspection, the engineer must comply with the request.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

subsection.def: relevant certificate of registration (有關註冊證書), in relation to a registered escalator engineer, means the certificate of registration issued to the engineer in respect of the registration;
relevant registration card (有關註冊證), in relation to a registered escalator engineer, means the registration card issued to the engineer in respect of the registration.

section.name: s29

part.heading: Requirements Relating to Applications Made under Section 148 of Ordinance

section.name: s66
section.heading: Application for exemption
section.leadIn: An application for an exemption under section 148(1) or (2) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must contain the information and particulars specified in the specified form.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Requirement to provide additional information etc. by Director
section.content: The Director may in writing require a person who makes any application under section 148(1) or (2) of the Ordinance to provide any information, particulars or documents that are reasonably necessary to enable the Director to determine the application concerned.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Preliminary reports and full reports of investigation of incidents

subsection.leadIn: A preliminary report required to be prepared and completed under section 40 or 70 of the Ordinance must be in the specified form and must contain the following information and particulars—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which and the time at which the incident occurred;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the place at which the incident took place;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the apparent cause of the incident;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the nature and particulars of the incident, including (if any) the death of, or injury to, any person and damage to any property as a result of the incident; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other information and particulars specified by the Director and relating to the incident.

subsection.leadIn: A full report required to be prepared and completed under section 40 or 70 of the Ordinance must contain the following information and particulars—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information and particulars specified in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) and (d);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a detailed description and explanation of the cause of the incident;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (if any) recommendations of corrective measures and their implementation programme; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other information and particulars specified by the Director and relating to the incident.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Offences on obstruction or removal of notices displayed under section 7 or 22

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully obstructs a responsible contractor referred to in section 7 in the performance of the contractor’s duty under that section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, removes a notice displayed under section 7.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully obstructs a responsible contractor referred to in section 22 in the performance of the contractor’s duty under that section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, removes a notice displayed under section 22.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
